qas.question: What is another term for Middle Persian?
When did Middle Persian start being u sed?
What are three languages employed by the Manichaeans?
What was the writing of Manichaean documents similar to?
Underwood dynasty was old Persian the official language?
What language was in use in Iran before the third century?
What are three spoken languages use by the Manchaeans?
Latin and Chinese writing were similar to what texts?

context: <b5_0>Middle Persian<b5_0/> (<a0_0>Pahlavi<a0_0/>) was the official language under the <b4_0>Sasanian dynasty<b4_0/> in Iran. It was in use from the <a1_0>3rd century CE<a1_0/> until the beginning of the 10th century. The script used for Middle Persian in this era underwent significant maturity. <a2_0><b6_0>Middle Persian, Parthian and Sogdian<b6_0/><a2_0/> were also used as literary languages by the Manichaeans, whose texts also survive in various non-Iranian languages, from Latin to Chinese. <b7_0>Manichaean texts<b7_0/> were written in a script closely akin to the <a3_0>Syriac script<a3_0/>.
